problem_text:
Suppose that G, H are countable or finite groups and A is a proper subgroup of G and H containing no non-trivial subgroup normal in both G and H. Can G∗A H be embedded in Sym(N) so that the image is highly transitive?
Comment of 2013: for partial results, see (S. V. Gunhouse, Highly transitive representations of free products on the natural numbers, Ph. D. Thesis Bowling Green State Univ., 1993; K. K. Hickin, J. London Math. Soc. (2), 46, no. 1 (1992), 81–91).
A. M. W. Glass
